Hello, I'm a software engineer in Utah with interest in system programming, devops, data science/engineering/analytics, mobile development, automation, and building server-side systems (networking & distributed systems). If only there were more hours in the day... and red bull were cheaper...


I guess simply put I like building complex systems.


I also am very interested in slightly off-topic items such as aeronautical electronics engineering, mechatronics, robotics, space exploration, and aquatic robotics. You could say choosing computer science over electrical engineering was a pretty tough decision. On occasion I still enjoy hacking on hardware with my Arduino, Atmel ATMega microcontrollers, and Raspberry Pi

I can be a bit of a performance freak sometimes... Even after running all front-end content through a minifier you can bet I'll go through it line-by-line and to check for any extra blank-spaces the minifier neglected to remove. When doing web developmnet, I live by the Chrome developer tools, including the PageSpeed Chrome extension.

But I also choose my tools carefully. My standard toolset is Python, Java, and Go. Why not C++? I was born & raised into CS with Java (high school AP CS) so I know it best. And with the release of Java 8, it's pretty well-recognized that it performs nearly as well as C++. Plus I'd rather build stuff and not slave over unnecessary memory leaks and messy syntax. If there's something where performance is absolutely critical, sure I'll jump down to C/C++, but Java has become pretty hard to beat. However Go is pretty beautiful. Simple like C, large standard libary like Java, clean syntax like Python, with blazing-fast compile times and the performance of being compiled. What's not to love? But we'll see in the coming months how it compares to Rust...

When not hacking around on my endless list of side projects, I go to classes at Brigham Young University, work part-time at Domo, work on LunchBox, read, play some MineCraft or hang around with some fellow humans.

Technical Skills

Front-End Web

HTML/CSS*, JavaScript*, jQuery*, AngularJS, Bootstrap

Back-End Web

PHP, Python*, Django*, Flask, Java, Node.js, Express, Go (learning)

Desktop/Systems Development

Java*, Python*, C/C++, Bash script

iOS*, Swift, Objective-C*, CocoaPods, Mogenerator, RestKit

Misc.
